name: Fighter
description: A master of martial combat, skilled with a variety of weapons and armor.
starting_equipment: Chain Mail or Leather Armor, Longbow, and 20 Arrows
Martial Weapon and Shield or Two Martial Weapons
Light Crossbow and 20 Bolts or Two Handaxes

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one fighting style option. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

features.name: Second Wind
features.description:
You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. As a bonus action, you can regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.

You have multiple uses of this feature (2 uses at levels 1-2, 3 uses at levels 3-9, 4 uses at levels 10-20). You regain one expended use after a short rest, and all expended uses after a long rest.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: Your training with weapons allows you to use the mastery properties of three kinds of weapons of your choice with which you have proficiency.

features.name: Action Surge
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, you can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. Starting at 17th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once on the same turn.

features.name: Tactical Mind
features.description: Starting at 2nd level, if you fail an ability check, you can expend a use of your Second Wind to add 1d10 to the check, potentially turning a failure into a success.

features.name: Martial Archetype
features.description: At 3rd level, you choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques. The archetype you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. You can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: You can use the mastery properties of four kinds of weapons.

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Martial Archetype Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Indomitable
features.description: Beginning at 9th level, you can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest. You can use this feature twice between long rests starting at 13th level and three times between long rests starting at 17th level.

features.name: Tactical Shift
features.description: At 9th level, whenever you activate Second Wind, you can move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

features.name: Martial Archetype Feature
features.description: You gain a feature from your Martial Archetype.

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.description: You can use the mastery properties of five kinds of weapons.

features.name: Extra Attack (2)
features.description: At 11th level, you can attack three times whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. Alternatively, you can take a feat.

features.name: Indomitable (2 uses)
features.description: You can use Indomitable twice between long rests.

features.name: Studied Attacks
features.description: At 13th level, when you miss with an attack roll, you can add your Intelligence modifier to the attack roll. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

features.name: Epic Boon
features.description: At 20th level, you gain an Epic Boon feat or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. Boons are special feats that grant powerful, unique abilities.

subclasses.name: Champion
subclasses.description: The archetypal Champion focuses on the development of raw physical power honed to deadly perfection. Those who model themselves on this archetype combine rigorous training with physical excellence to deal devastating blows.

3.name: Improved Critical
3.description: Beginning when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

3.name: Remarkable Athlete
3.description: Starting at 3rd level, you have advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, when you make a running long jump, the distance you can cover increases by a number of feet equal to your Strength modifier. You also have advantage on Athletics checks.

subclasses.name: Eldritch Knight
subclasses.description: The archetypal Eldritch Knight combines the martial mastery common to all fighters with a careful study of magic. Eldritch Knights use magical techniques similar to those practiced by wizards. They focus their study on two of the eight schools of magic: abjuration and evocation.

3.name: Spellcasting
3.description: You augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells. You learn two cantrips of your choice from the wizard spell list. You know three 1st-level wizard spells of your choice, two of which you must choose from the abjuration and evocation schools. You have two 1st-level spell slots.

3.name: Weapon Bond
3.description: You learn a ritual that creates a magical bond between yourself and one weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour. The weapon must be within your reach throughout the ritual. Once bonded, you can't be disarmed of that weapon unless you are incapacitated. You can summon a bonded weapon as a bonus action, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand.

subclasses.name: Psi Warrior
subclasses.description: Awake to the psionic power within, a Psi Warrior is a fighter who augments their physical might with psi-infused weapon strikes, telekinetic lashes, and barriers of mental force.

3.name: Psionic Power
3.description: You harbor a wellspring of psionic energy within yourself. This energy is represented by your Psionic Energy dice. At 3rd level, you have 4 Psionic Energy dice (d6). You regain all expended dice after a long rest, and you regain 1 die after a short rest.

3.name: Protective Field
3.description: When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to expend one Psionic Energy die, rolling the die and reducing the damage taken by the number rolled plus your Intelligence modifier (minimum reduction of 1).

3.name: Psionic Strike
3.description: Once on each of your turns when you hit a target with a weapon attack, you can expend one Psionic Energy die to deal extra force damage to the target equal to the die roll plus your Intelligence modifier.

3.name: Telekinetic Movement
3.description: You can move an object or a creature with your mind. As an action, you expend one Psionic Energy die and target one object or willing creature you can see within 30 feet. If the target weighs up to 60 pounds, you can move it up to 30 feet in any direction (including upward).

subclasses.name: Battle Master
subclasses.description: Those who emulate the archetypal Battle Master employ martial techniques passed down through generations. To a Battle Master, combat is an academic field, sometimes including subjects beyond battle such as weaponsmithing and calligraphy.

3.name: Combat Superiority
3.description: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice. At 3rd level, you learn 3 maneuvers and have 4 superiority dice (d8). A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest. The save DC for your maneuvers is 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

3.name: Student of War
3.description: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice. Additionally, you gain proficiency in one skill from the Fighter skill list that you don't already have.
